cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: A vulnerability was detected in net/http of the Go standard library when parsing very large HTTP header values, causing a crash and subsequent denial of service. This vulnerability affects both clients and servers written in Go, however, servers are only vulnerable if the value of MaxHeaderBytes has been increased from the default.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: panic in ReadRequest and ReadResponse when reading a very large header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This vulnerability potentially affects any component written in Go that uses net/http from the standard library. In OpenShift Container Platform (OCP), OpenShift Virtualization, OpenShift ServiceMesh (OSSM) and OpenShift distributed tracing (formerly OpenShift Jaeger), no server side component allows HTTP header values larger than 1 MB (the default), preventing this vulnerability from being exploited by malicious clients. It is possible for components that make client connections to malicious servers to be exploited, however the maximum impact is a crash. This vulnerability is rated Low for the following components: 
* OpenShift Container Platform
* OpenShift Virtualization 
* OpenShift ServiceMesh
* OpenShift distributed tracing components.

2. Reduce the need for complex configuration procedures
3. Embrace GitOps practices by using simplified configuration as yaml
